channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unit doing work/remodeling creating piles of waste, 7th September
item.description:
A small unit halfway down the lane has a pile of waste next to it which they replenish all the time. It has some black bin bags in it, some building waste, a lot of food packaging and rotting food waste with flies around it. It blows around in the wind.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fortescue Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffit, 7th September
item.description:
Lewisham High street opposite Registry office. Remove graffiti from bus shelter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham High Street, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Every week more commercial waste is put out directly onto street or next to bins and is not collected., 7th September
item.description:
For months this stretch of the street has recycling, commercial waste and regular black bin bags dumped directly on street where they sit for weeks before collection. They tear apart and rubbish is blowing around in the wind. Flies buzz around the rubbish.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fortescue Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds along kerb of St Andrews Drive, 7th September
item.description:
Weeds along the kerbside of St Andrews Drive and the drains blocked. Also loads of broken glass on both sides of road. This is a constant problem on this road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress abandoned, 7th September
item.description:
On priors mead, EN1 3LS, fronting flat 31 and 32, there is a blue mattress abandoned in front of the set of stairs since last Wednesday. Could I please request an efficient removal of the item by Enfield Council? Many thanks Kind regards, Max

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Mead, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three recycling bins, 7th September
item.description:
In the courtyard of Verdant Court flats, of further Green Road SE 16 . The three full recycling bins have not been collected for three weeks., they are overflowing. In addition, we need to use the waist bins., which are also overflowing at times , because the recycling bins are not being collected. There is a fourth recycling bin left in further Green Road which needs to be returned to the courtyard of the flats near the MOT. Garage..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Further Green Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Empty tree pod between 155 and 157 Bourne Vale, 7th September
item.description:
There is an empty tree pod (a wooden pole is in the ground but no tree) between 155 and 157 Bourne Vale. Please could a suitable new replacement street tree be planted here during the next tree planting season beginning in November 2025.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Vale, Hayes, London

item.title: Weeds growing on the pavement in Northbourne, 7th September
item.description:
There are street weeds growing on the pavement in Northbourne. These weeds need to be sprayed with weed killer and the 'die back' removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northbourne, Hayes, London

item.title: Overflowing Litter Bins in Abandoned House, 7th September
item.description:
Litter bins full outside of the abandoned (?after fire months ago) 66 Acre Lane. Bins open and attracting vermin. Please get street crew to clear as a one-off even if inside property boundary.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Acre Lane, Brixton, London
